column4: hey all, im having a slight problem with changing my uid. the usermod  -u uid user_name  command seemed to work but it didnt set the uid recursively so there are tons of errors when logging in. any ideas?
so im thinking i should use usermod to change my uid then use chown on my home file like so: chown -hR jackinloadup /home/jackinloadup
yup, if ownership is the problem
i will try it out thanks ^_^
put your startups before the 'exit 0' line
what do u mean the exit 0 line?
/etc/rc.local doesnt run anything by default...there is an 'exit o' at the last line of the file
i dont understand how that would help my uid problem? in any case i cant think of anything that "i" tell to startup. everything should be default
sorry, that wasnt meant for you

hey i chown helped my uid problem a lot but im still having a problem none of my gnome-panel things are showing up and i cant seem to launch it with alt-f2 any ideas as to what other files i might need to chown?
you can just add them to your panel, rightclick then add
yeah tried that.. :-( it doesnt show up its just create folder and stuff. just to clarify there are no panels launched at the moment and trying to launch them manually fails
just exactly what happend before this?

i changed my uid and chown my home folder and a few tmp/ folders that were listed with my name.. it logged in clean but no gnome-panels are showing up. i got a terminal window up and tried running 'gnome-panel' and it says a panel is running.. cant see it though.
i think i solved my problem.. THANK YOU! for your help chown worked like a charm
